website_summaries.verdict: A popular model for senior care, this memory loss clock offers users a number of unique function options not offered by other similar products.
pros: Divides the day into four cycles for easy understanding
Screen lights can be displayed in either white or yellow
Auto-dimming option can be turned off or on
High-resolution screen makes words easy to read
cons: A few customers had issues with it initially turning on when they first plugged it in

customer_reviews.title: Great For Mother
customer_reviews.text: My sweet mother-in-law is 89 years young and has some tremors and pre-parkinsons We bought this as a gift for her. Super easy to use and set up, plus easy to adjust the time and date. This clock can easily be seen from over 12 feet away. It is a lifesaver as for when she pops up at 4am and wonders as to whether or not it is AM or PM she looks at the clock and it even mentions Dusk/Dawn Or evening Plus the big bold fontes helps her stay on track with meds 4-5 times a day Wonderful product and has been a Godsend for our mother and family
customer_reviews.author: Ronbro C.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR SHORT TERM MEMORY LOSS
customer_reviews.text: Best clock I could have found! My husband is only 52, but due to multiple TBIs has short term memory loss. He forgets what day it is, the month, whether it’s morning or afternoon. This clock is amazing! The digits and writing are very clear and legible. It has assited him without feeling so lost throughout the day and night. Helping ease anxiety and he has stopped asking repetitively what day it is, giving him more confidence and independence. I did need to set the clock for him, but the battery back up keeps the time going if we lose power.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: For our parent
customer_reviews.text: The product did exactly what the manufacturer said it would do. Regarding gifting, if the individual you want to give this to, without set up support from any one, has dementia or difficulty understanding, don't gift. Buy it, then go set it up for the person. Value, worth every penny. My parent likes it when they forget the date/time or day. For a person with limited vision remember to set close to where they usually sit or spend their time. I do have to point it out to my parent that the clock will tell you the date/time. Very easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: yorciv

customer_reviews.title: Just what she needed
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my 90 year old mother whose eyesight is failing. She can't read her clocks, paper calendars or TV screens and became quite often unaware of times, dates and days of the week. The large display, choices of light colors and auto dim have helped her - and us - a lot!
customer_reviews.author: beaglesmom

customer_reviews.title: So good we bought TWO! This was a great solve. She has it right below her tv ...
customer_reviews.text: Mom could never keep the days straight. She'd take a nap in the afternoon and wake up later the same day and think it was the next day. She never remembers to update her clocks for daylight savings and her phone and DVR clocks are too small to read. This was a great solve. She has it right below her tv and relies on it daily. UPDATE: We actually bought a second clock since she spends a lot of time in her living room and her dining room. She was constantly forgetting to bring the clock with her when she changed rooms! Would love a smaller one for her bedroom!
customer_reviews.author: AmberWithWings

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my parents and could not be more pleased at how easy they are to set up and to see. They come with an easel stand, but also are ready to hang. They plug in, so there's no issue with failing batteries. Everything you want to know for quick orientation is instantly available in large, clear type. By the way, the words "Dementia Clock" do not appear anywhere on the product or packaging, so it does its job without insult.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie C. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to help with keeping him date and time-aware
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my Dad. Great tool to help with keeping him date and time-aware. He knows to look at the clock before asking. I started working with him on this while still in the post-acute setting, before getting him home. It helped with the transition. This will not fix sundowning, but reassures him. We talk about what people do at certain times, to give reference points. Unrelated to the memory issue, he has a hard time reading across/or jumbling the lines and transposes numbers. After the fact, I thought that a scroll of one line at a time (and holding each line for a minute) would be helpful. Maybe it exists - but if not, something to consider!
customer_reviews.author: JBV

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: It will not keep the right time, it will lose 5 to 7 minutes, I reset the time and it still lost 5 to 7 minutes the picture shows 3 clocks and it’s still wrong
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!! 94 year olds security!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My dad is 94 and starting to have some "time of day"confusion. I placed it in his bedroom on the nightstand(as older folks wake up during the night confused). He feels like a million dollars! He says he feels secure and reassured knowing if it is morning or night. I am ordering another for his living room by his recliner !! Definitely worth it to see my loved one secure.
customer_reviews.author: Char Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The BEST clock EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this clock for my Mother-in-Law who is suffering from cancer. She has a hard time remembering when to take her meds. This clock has been a GOD send!! We set the times for her meds and now she does not miss them. Plus she is prone to falling asleep and waking up thinking it is the next day. This clock helps her stay on track as to what day and time it is BEST CLOCK EVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expected Better at the Price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this clock for several months. A few months ago I noticed it was running fast and it did not bother me too much because I like the other features. Then the time difference started to be a real issue and I tried to go to the menu option to fix the time but it would not change anything. Tried plugging and unplugging but of course that doesn't do anything either. So I am stuck with a bad clock now. Does anybody have any suggestions how to fix the time on this clock? I entered the question in the Questions section also.
customer_reviews.author: mlenya

customer_reviews.title: Mom Loves This
customer_reviews.text: this was for my mother who is 96 and still in her own home. She would get mixed up on the day of the week. She loves this...easy to read and understand. We also like the feature that this does NOT automatically dim at 7:00. She keeps this in her living room and she is in there after 7:00 so it is important that she can read this at any time of day or night. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Heitzig

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after less than 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Well, today I awoke to find the clock with only the top half working. I checked to see if there were any troubleshooting ideas in the manual and there wasn't. I turned it off for a while and turned it back on and the same thing was happening. The return policy only gave me 1 month and the "support" policy ended less than 2 weeks ago, so I am stuck buying another. I expected more for the $40 price I paid. While it worked I loved it. But I need to know more than that it is "Monday morning".
customer_reviews.author: Barb in Katy, TX

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: The information display is wonderful. It delivers the information about the day, date, time and time period of the day.clearly and without ambiguity. It is large enough to be easily read without being too big. The one and only negative is the "wooden" frame. It is a wood print on plastic and is not at all convincing. It's a shame too because it detracts from the overall appearance of the clock. My wife loves the clock. It delivers the time/date information that she needs to stay oriented. We can't ask for more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Greentree Maine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great clock for elderly who get confused with days the week or am and pm.
customer_reviews.author: Roy W.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely helpful for grandma!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 94yo grandma who has been getting more and more confused about what time of day it is ("is it 5 in the morning or 5 at night??" type of confusion). This has really taken care of that issue for her. I set it up for her, and it's really simple to operate. The letters are a great size. She can read it from across the room. The auto-dim feature is also nice for nighttime- it's still very visible, but the lights won't blind you! You can choose from yellow or white font. We liked the yellow!
customer_reviews.author: Kenna

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 7 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: After only 7 months, this clock stopped working. My husband has dementia. He became dependent upon this clock. It has upset him that the clock no longer works. We tried new batteries and everything we could think of. It remains on a blue screen that reads " Day Clock SDC008". We would like a replacement and wait to hear from the company. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Page

customer_reviews.title: Excellent clock for Elderly
customer_reviews.text: This is a great clock for the elderly and those with dementia to help them stay on track. I bought this for my mom who would habitually get up at night thinking it was much earlier than it was. Now she can see it as soon as she leaves the bathroom and knows if it's time to get up. Very bright LED display even with dimming option. My mom faces clock away from her at night so the light won't shine in her face. That would be the only thing I would change. A much dimmer option for night would be great. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a product like this!
customer_reviews.author: msnrn

customer_reviews.title: Alarms turned into awful static sound
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 91 year old father who naps frequently and needs a clock that shows the date, day of week, and time and also has alarms for his meals. It worked at first but in the first week, it went dead numerous times and had to be restarted by aides. Then the alarms which had worked fine turned into an awful "static" sound that was really annoying. He started calling it "The Grouch". I am returning it. Hope to find something similar that works better.
customer_reviews.author: Toledo girl

customer_reviews.title: SVINZ 3 Alarms Dementia Clock
customer_reviews.text: I help take care of my 95yr old Grandma and lately she has really been getting confused between day and night and what day of the week it is. She's mostly home bound so the days tend to run together. She also can't see very well. When I came across this clock I knew it was exactly what she needed. The fact that it literally says the day and if it's morning.noon, or night helps a lot, especially when the time changes and it's light when she wakes up and light when she goes to bed. The letters and numbers are just the right size for her to read and she was happy so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic Worth about $10
customer_reviews.text: For $40 I expected a more substantial product. It was really flimsy and I guess I should have spent more time studying the dimensions before I made the purchase, as I expect this clock to be about twice as large as it is. I can't imagine how anyone with vision problems could see this from across the room.
customer_reviews.author: George Maio

customer_reviews.title: Love it! And hopefully it will prove to help ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this when the head nurse at the nursing home where my parents reside said they couldn't see their previous clock well, and were often awake middle of the night, wondering if time to get up, etc. Even though not really suffering with dementia, they sleep a lot off and on during the days, and days become blurred, hard to keep track what day of the week, or what date, it is. This helps them feel more oriented and at ease. They can see it well at night, while not being too bright. Love it! And hopefully it will prove to help them get a better night's rest!
customer_reviews.author: Grannie Annie

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: Besides that the stand area on the back of the clock was broken, see picture, there is no battery backup! I’ve been trying to get a clock like this with 2 simple features: auto & manual dimming and a battery backup. This is the 3’rd disappointing product. The others also advertised these features and the two previous had NEITHER, this has the ‘auto dimmable feature but no battery backup and it’s made soooo cheaply Not worth $40.
customer_reviews.author: Noel M

customer_reviews.title: Great Clock for Gramma!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for Gramma. She loves it! The lighted panel with words and numbers are large enough for her to read, even at a distance. Lately she been getting confused with dates, days, and even time of day- whether it's morning or night. This clock shows everything she needs to know. It will read "Good Morning! Today is April 16, 2019", and then the time indicator beneath it. We just wished that it had a battery operated back-up feature in addition to the electric plug-in cord just in case the power goes out. Other than that it's been very beneficial and helpful for Gramma! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: E.K.D.

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: It made a strange winding groan noise after the alarm sounded and ended after one minute. The only way to get rid of it was to unplug it and replug it in. My mother had to sleep in the other bedroom to get away from the annoying noise. The design to turn off the alarm with the back buttons is awkward especially if you want to hang it on the wall. She wouldn't use buttons to turn it off and the auto off was not an off due to the noise, I returned it. Everything else about it was great but not useful for her needs with this defect and design.
customer_reviews.author: bella

customer_reviews.title: A++ highly recommend ,best clock on market
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this was pleasantly surprised this clock very impressive look super easy to set up didn't even need manuals gorgeous display love how the brightness goes with the sun meaning bright all day n gradually goes into a nice easy on eyes display see it perfectly at night as during day bold either white or a smooth yellow color I prefer the yellow color white was little to bright but u can adjust brightness or auto fit n it goes with daylight very cool features has alarm but dont need it I use phone like most ,all in all highly recommend it 5 stars across the board, super fast shipping well boxed definitely buy as a gift to
customer_reviews.author: tatzzz65

customer_reviews.title: A God Send!
customer_reviews.text: My brother, who is going thru treatment for cancer is in love with the two clocks I sent him. The immunotherapy makes him tired and he can sleep for hours, waking confused and disoriented. He looks right to the clock to figure out what time it is, what DAY it is and if it is day or night. We also first bought this for our elderly mother who would become disoriented. This is a marvelous product.
customer_reviews.author: KnowledgeIsPower

customer_reviews.title: SCREEN WENT BLACK AFTER 2 MONTHS - DEAD!
customer_reviews.text: After about two months my clock went dead. The screen is black - Nothing. I've checked the connections, and made sure it's plugged in, but no change. I'm bummed out because I actually really liked the clock when it worked- it's a wonderful idea! But of course, 2 months isn't acceptable for how long it works. IS THERE ANYTHING THAT CAN BE DONE? I REALLY JUST WISH IT WORKED AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Sportycat

customer_reviews.title: Great clock for my elderly mother!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this clock.. my 88 year old mother really loves it as I gave to her as a gift. I think one of the most important features on this clock is that it displays. Morning , Afternoon and Evening.. Of course the date, day and time are important too. She lives in a 2 room assisted living retirement home and has it in her living room. It’s really hard to come up with gifts for her. I think I will get her another one for her bedroom next gift I think I will get her another one for h
customer_reviews.author: Timmy

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine until April of 2017 when it suddenly stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in November of 2016 for my elderly mother. It was kept untouched on her desk. It worked fine until April of 2017 when it suddenly stopped working. It suddenly will not turn on. I think it should have worked for more than 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Chaney

customer_reviews.title: Display is upside down and backwards
customer_reviews.text: + It's slow... Lost 3 minutes in 2 months. Display worked great initially, but noticed display flipped upside down and backwards 2 months after we bought it and 10 days after return policy expired. No way to factory reset. Read other posted comments/questions. At least a couple others experienced the same problem. One user fixed it by whacking it over her knee a few times. I ended up taking the thing apart and noticed the display corrected itself after tugging on the ribbon cable. I'll hang it back on the wall for now. But if it flips over again, it's going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Notab

customer_reviews.title: 5 for 5 quit after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Product just quits!!! Have purchased 5 of these type clocks. Two of this exact model. None lasted more than 4-6 months. Most recent one purchased 5 months ago. Died yesterday. Seems others reviewers have similar issues. Mine lost 1-2 minutes every couple of months. Will look for another product. These are too expensive to keep buying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clock simply just STOPPED working
customer_reviews.text: After switching to FIOS One, we no longer had the luxury of a cable box, with clock. We bought this to sit on top of the new box. Large enough numbers for all to see from a distance. Worked great until one day the screen went blank and the clock just stopped working. It plugs in (no batteries), so we tested the clock all around the house. It simply died. We had it for a month and a half. No longer able to return or exchange. Won't be buying this or anything from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D. Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Great clock, but IT STOPPED WORKING AFTER 7 MONTHS and supplier would not respond
customer_reviews.text: Folks, this is a great clock. It worked perfectly for 7 months and then flat-out quit. I e-mailed the supplier (support@sviz.com) and never heard a word. There is supposed to be a 12 month warranty from the manufacturer, but that's worthless if the supplier won't respond. 7 months was long past Amazon's return window, so I had to absorb the cost and instead buy from anther supplier. If you're going to buy this otherwise great clock, be sure to buy an add-on warranty before checking out on Amazon's website. A word to the wise....
customer_reviews.author: J. Price

customer_reviews.title: Great clock
customer_reviews.text: This clock is amazing especially for someone with dementia. Even thought I don't have dementia I bought it for my bedside clock because when I wake up without my glasses it is sometimes hard for me to see the time on my old clock, not with this one. My sister recommended the clock and once I set it up I told her I had a billboard on my nightstand now (I was just pulling her leg). I wish I would have know about this clock when I was caring for my MIL who had dementia and would ask all day long what day it was or what time it was. Great clock! Large print so it's Super easy to read!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this clock
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars, because my particular one gains about 5 minutes a month. I do not yet know if that can be tweaked somehow. I love being able to see the day and time with a glance from across the room! I am retired and often will do a project through the night, then sleep into the day, and it is great to have it tell me morning or evening, when it is so dark out here in the winter you cannot tell the difference. In Alaska the darkness can be the same at 6am or 6pm.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Lowrance

customer_reviews.title: It went blank
customer_reviews.text: I loved this clock when I bought it for my mum. I read independent reviews, they pointed to this clock for its ease, usability, dim light at dusk and ability to change the display color to yellow. BUT yesterday, this clock went blank and would not turn on. So sadly, I am now back in the shopping mode for another clock for my mum.
customer_reviews.author: Bisqi

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: The large print clock indicating whether it is morning or evening along with the date is so practical. I especially appreciated that it didn't mention Alzheimer's or Dementia on the packaging (I can't emphasize enough how important that was [I gave this as a gift]!). It would be helpful however, if there was a brief easy to understand sheet of directions as I'm not sure everyone would be able to figure out the arrows on the back. Yes, I think it is intuitive, but to some older folks it could pose a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For my grandmother...but also for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after hearing from a friend's mother how much she loved her clock. My grandmother really depends on the clock for when she wakes up from naps in her chair and isn't sure how long she was asleep. The clock gives her all of the important information about what time of day it is. She talks about her clock and thanks for me buying it for her every time I go for a visit. I think it might be time to get my own clock. My friend's mother has since passed away and so now my friend uses the clock in her own bedroom and loves it! It's a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Liked this clock a lot until it died after only 5 months. Screen just went blank and we can't get it back up. Update: I turned if off overnight and it came back on the next morning. I contacted the company about the warranty and heard back right away. But they only wanted photos to use to determine the problem, which seemed an impossible task to me.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mahon

customer_reviews.title: large display
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for someone who asked me to find a very large illuminated clock so he wouldn't have to find his glasses to know what time it was in the dark. He likes it; it was initially a bit bright at night and we couldn't figure out how to dim it in the settings menu - but we put a piece of tinted art film over it, and that has brought it to a brightness level akin to what he really wanted. The settings menu may be confusing, but ultimately this is a good price for a utilitarian clock.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Extremely helpful
customer_reviews.text: Friend is experiencing cognitive decline. The clock helps establish what part of the day it is as well as date and time. That is extremely helpful. Clock has a soft glow, is nightlight-like. And for any normally functioning retired person who no longer has to show up for work at a set time, does not all day long see day and date info, it is as helpful as looking at that info on the daily paper, phone or computer. Just a handy, good looking device for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Love having period of the day as well as time of day, date and day of the week. Only comes in white is a lone downside.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 81 yr old mom with dementia. While I could find several options of calendar clocks with day of the week, date, time this one was the only one that seemed have all those PLUS the period of the day (afternoon, evening, etc) She had difficulty differentiating am and pm so this solved that. The features described all work as well as expected. The only negative for me is that it's only available in white. I'd like to have charcoal or black or variations of those.
customer_reviews.author: A Mom

customer_reviews.title: This thing is annoying
customer_reviews.text: It is very bright. It does have dimming option but you have to do it manually every night even though the option is called auto dimming lol. I bought a second only because my mom liked it not realizing later on how dumb it is. I would say that for the price I might as well just pay a little more and just buy a tablet that can do more but oh well. I wish it would list the Holiday it is on the actual day that would be great too.
customer_reviews.author: JQ

customer_reviews.title: Great clock but it broke after three months.
customer_reviews.text: Updated review. The clock stopped working today about three months since I received it. SO sad because I really like this clock. I bought this for my father who has dementia and is in an assisted living facility. As he rarely leaves his room, he has no concept of day or time. The clock looks exactly like it does in the picture. It is easy to read from a distance and very easy to program. I would highly recommend this to anyone with a relative with cognitive problems or just anyone who wants to be able to glance, not squint, to see the time and day.
customer_reviews.author: Ballousmom

customer_reviews.title: Great elderly/dementia panel clock: 8 languages and a very large screen text
customer_reviews.text: I like the product fo rmy 96 year old mother with dementia, which is as described. Auto dimming is automatic on at 7:00 PM and off at 7:00 AM. I live in the Caribbean. I would gladly discard the alarm function in exchange for the ability to set the dimming time or permanently control dimming. Also, power cord could be longer. In spite of personal wishes, the product is very good, settings menu is easy to use and very complete and it is a quality product. No complaints! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jose E. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think my Dad really realized the benefits of this clock when i gave it to him. After using it for even a few days, he's in love with it. He sometimes fall asleep in his chair in the late afternoon, often waking up to darkness and confusion. He would fumble around to find his flip phone because it shows him am or pm and then he could get his bearings. This clock brings him right back to present time. It's large and bright font is just perfect for him. I highly recommend this to anyone dealing with even early stages of forgetfulness.
customer_reviews.author: MeadowGal

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. One for my TBI husband and one to go to the dementia unit for my sister in her room. Hope they stay put . My sister loved it as she has trouble identifying time of day and month. We are hoping her "knowing" the time of day will let her sleep when she should instead of her being up in the halls. My husband is always a bit confused. But it is helping him track what he likes to watch on tv on certain days. All in all - a good buy and a good product. All nursing home rooms should be automatically equipped with these.
customer_reviews.author: DiJeay

customer_reviews.title: Great for ANYONE!!
customer_reviews.text: My sister had a stroke a year ago and has some damage to her right eye. After asking me everyday," What day is it? What time is it?", I thought this clock might work, hanging it on the wall close to her. I absolutely love it! She looks at it alot and will tell me, It's so & so's birthday today. It also has alarms that can be set to remind us of her medicine. I just love this so much, that I went and bought one for my aging mother as well!
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this clock! Originally bought one for my 88 year old mother with dementia. It is perfect and can be seen across the room. So good, that we bought another for her bedroom...then another for my husband...then another for my father-in-law...then another for our daughter who wanted one for for her classroom! Everyone who sees it, loves it. This will definitely be our go-to gift idea from now on!
customer_reviews.author: MASLubbock

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% as advertised, but still tells time and day
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time and in brand new condition. The menu buttons feel cheap. If this thing falls from a substantial height, it'll most likely will shatter into pieces. My main issue with it is the background color. The background color should be a deep black as posted in the main picture, but it's more of a dark grey/blue color. It's function as a clock is fine, but I won't be purchasing this again or recommending it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Clive Stone

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE CLOCK
customer_reviews.text: Lasted less than five months!!! Yes, it did have a superior display, but all of a sudden display was inverted, totally illegible. You would need a mirror to read the display! The company doesn’t respond to emails and company does not respond to phone calls either. I do not recommend this company since they offer no support and Don’t care they are shipping defective items. A simple display clock isn’t supposed to last just five months! Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Dead in less than 8 months!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this the end of February 2019; less than 8 months ago. It’s been great. Until today. Woke up and it’s dead. Tried plugging into various outlets and nothing. This clock has been in the same spot since we got it, never touched. And in less than 8 months it quit working. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3 boys

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS CLOCK.  LOVE IT.  I HAVE IT ACROSS FROM MY BED.  ON KAWARA IN MY BEDROOM.
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the fact that the literature is marketing these clocks for people with Alzheimer's and Dimentia. Who doesn't want the Day, Time, and Time of Day mapped out to them when they are waking from a deep sleep. There is an artist named On Kawara who paints everyday, the date, exactly in this style. I think the clock is stylish and mature and it has THREE ALARMS. Somedays you need three. The alarms are too short and go off in about two minutes per alarm. So you might want a Moonbeam Alarm Clock from L.L. Bean as a companion. That is what I did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best helper out there!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this clock has helped my dad in so many ways. From 'Sundowners' reorientation to medication and meal time reminders...it's so easy to read and understand. I almost miss the 3am phone calls wondering where the coffee pot is! Get one! It's as wonderful as it appears to be. My dad asked me to turn that darned alarm off! So I asked him if it reminded him to take his bedtime meds? After a pause, he agreed that it was, after all, quite effective. Get one for your precious senior. They deserve it and the independence it brings them.
customer_reviews.author: kb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect clock
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. Got this for my father for Christmas, he has short term memory loss and is constantly asking what time it is and what day it is, and last month I had to travel for work and was unable to answer his calls. I know he was confused about the days/times so when I found this I knew it would be a great thing for him when he can't reach me and my mom is not home. It has worked great. He loves it and loves to show it off to everyone .
customer_reviews.author: vanessa_C

customer_reviews.title: Is It Morning or Evening?
customer_reviews.text: I'm retired and take naps. This clock is the answer to my goofs. I woke up at 7:30. It was light outside. I got up, made my coffee, took my medicine, and turned on my financial channel. Hey! Where is the ticker? Then I realized it was 7:30 pm, not am. My only flaw is the clock could be more dim as it's next to my bed, and I'm clearly dim. Enjoy this and give it as a gift to seniors living alone. We (sometimes) don't know the time of day.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bordelon

customer_reviews.title: Right idea, bad value
customer_reviews.text: These clocks are expensive. It's just a bright screen and should function well for the price, but I bought two and in 6 months one is dead and they don't tell time well. The time is off by 3-5 minutes every month, if you don't adjust it can be way off over after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Clock for those suffering with Alzheimer or Memory Challenges
customer_reviews.text: My mother-in-law is challenged with Alzheimer and is very often confused by the time, day and year. Will often ask this repeatedly. This clock was the perfect solution. Bright, easy to read (and set up). It is prominently displayed where she can glance as often as she wants. It has sure helped too as she no longer asks what day, time, year it is, rather will on occasion comment to us about what day, time and year it is. A nice change and it seems to make her happy that she is in the know.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Looks really good
customer_reviews.text: Hung this up in the bathroom so I could know what time it was while I got ready, showered, pooped, etc. It looks great and was super easy to set up. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: K.K.

customer_reviews.title: FAILED in LESS THAN A YEAR
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed this clock while it worked. This is one of those rare instances that I have been disappointed with a product purchased on Amazon. One day white ghostly vertical lines appeared across the screen then it disappeared and became a white flashlight. I shut it down then tried the next day. The screen was a bright blank light. Has not worked since. We expected it to last a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: J.  Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Product malfunction
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these clocks. One is perfectly fine. The other had to be replaced due to malfunction. It was replaced and has been working fine until today. It is now doing the same thing as the one that was replaced. Is this a common problem with this product? Should I look for another clock . I am worried that if I get another one that it will do the same thing. Will you replace it again or should I look for a different clock? I was asked to rate the clock. The one that is working every since I got it, I rate excellent. The 2 that have malfunction I rate a 0.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Endorsed by Elder Moms!  They love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought Two! For our mother’s as they transitioned to independent living apartments in their late 80’s. Both of them love it. Helps them keep track of their days. Easy for MIL with macular degeneration to read. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! Wake from an afternoon nap confused if it’s the next morning? Nope! Tells you right away, time of day, date, etc. wake in the middle of the night, it clearly says 2AM PreDawn!!
customer_reviews.author: EJay

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but it runs fast
customer_reviews.text: It runs fast about 5 minutes a month, other than that it's fine... It displays the date and day fine... It has a handy dimming ability but it's a clock... And it doesn't keep the time correctly... Wish I had bought the one that is time sensitive to the atomic clock
customer_reviews.author: JanBrown

customer_reviews.title: Great for retirees who think every day is Saturday!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love this clock. As retirees, it’s sometimes easy to forget what day it is (every day feels like Saturday!). It’s a perfect size to see from across the room without having to fumble for glasses in the early morning and has just the right level of brightness (not too harsh at night). And if you’ve ever taken a long late afternoon nap, it’s actually useful to wake up and be told that yup, you haven’t overslept, it’s still “afternoon”, LOL. Might also be great for young kids to teach them about days of the week.
customer_reviews.author: Anatole Burkin

customer_reviews.title: easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Our neighbor was calling in the middle of the night frightened about " what is happening to the world" She would fall asleep in the afternoon and wake up in the night and think it should still be afternoon. It frightened her to look outside to see no lights on at the neighbors, etc. She is so appreciative and now knows if it is morning, afternoon, evening or night because the clock has those words displayed as well as date and time. Large numbers, easy to read, no abbreviations.
customer_reviews.author: Diane M

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE:  WON’T LAST!  DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: They have agreed to replace the broken clock with a new one! I am very happy with their agreement to replace. I simply sent an email and a picture of front and back of clock while plugged in. This 5 star review is based upon their quick email response and flexibility in providing a new clock. Hopefully the replacement will be more reliable. More to come..... The clock broke after 5 months of operating! What a disappointment. Please pay attention to the reviews that say this brand stops working! What a waste of $40!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: My 90 year old mother loves it
customer_reviews.text: My mother has macular degeneration and a weakening mind that she hates. She has lost the ability to read a standard size clock. She has the twilights that confuse her as to daylight and dark AM and PM. The day of the week and the date can confuse her. She recognizes the temporal discontinuity. I bought 2. One for her bedroom. One for the living room. She’s declared them “Perfect!” and the best practical gift in years. I highly recommend this clock.
customer_reviews.author: Sotto voce

customer_reviews.title: Information clock gives us great for dimentia but sometimes I forget date and it’s right there. It’s also attractive
customer_reviews.text: It was much smaller than our last clock that had same info and we liked..- my husband has dimentia and deteriorated sight, so I didn’t know if smaller size would work. It actually worked better due to brightness and how easy it is to see. He really liked the way this clock laid out the day and says it’s afternoon as well as PM - or predawn/etc and also the date with the year- All this made him love it! Young children like it as well- I got the white frame/ it has a black background with white (bright but doesn’t hurt eyes) letters I am pleased and give it with 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: suzy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect except for 1 issue
customer_reviews.text: The clock is super big and worth the money stays super bright all day until it gets dark out then the clock brightness gets lower and makes it hard to see otherwise it’s perfect especially for older people that can’t see well
customer_reviews.author: alexa

customer_reviews.title: Display went Dyslexic!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this in October 2019 and by January 2020 the display had completely reversed itself. In other words, all the letters and words were backwards! It was fine if you held it up to a mirror...but really, really disappointing. Unfortunately the window for a refund has closed. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Art Lover

customer_reviews.title: Very good clock
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad as he has dementia and struggles with being able to tell whether it is morning or evening. It is actually a five-star clock but I gave it 4-stars as it would have been a better product for him if the clock indicated "morning" and "evening" rather than A.M. and P.M. (a clock like that is now available). It is very easy to set, even for my dad, good display, and you can change the color of the display. Excellent clock
customer_reviews.author: Larry M. Tedrow

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep time
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on desire for setting multiple alarms. This feature was too much of a hassle to do the job. So we use it for a general table top clock. Easy to see, and the light adjusts to the time of day. Now, why only two stars, you ask? This is a plug in digital clock that should keep near perfect time. Six months in and it has fallen farther and farther behind the time on my cellphone. This is a clock for Alzheimer’s patients!!! Last thing they need is a clock that have to dork with. Alternately, one could find a silver lining in the thought that days are actually getting longer....
customer_reviews.author: neely

customer_reviews.title: Good clock for elderly people
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product because its ready to use right out of the box. I plugged it in and the time was set even the dimming was set to what I needed. There are a lot of options for changing dimming, color of display and alarm settings. However I bought it for my mom who is having difficulty with time, date and day . I think this will be able to help her and she loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa S.

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: This clock is awesome! My 91 year old mother-in-law was losing track of time, at times being confused between day and night and what day of the week it was.. Her sleep habits were having her up at any hour. We placed the clock in the kitchen next to her meds. Boom! Problem solved! Her awareness of morning, afternoon, evening and night reordered her life! She would come the kitchen and read off the time, day and date and the part of the day it was. So glad we got this clock! Highly recommend it. Everyone in the household loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Celtic Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our situation
customer_reviews.text: My 87 yr old mother has Alzheimer's but is still able to live on her own, with lots of help. Her biggest challenge was knowing what day it is and waking up on time to catch the shuttle to the day center. This beauty solved both problems. Once set its all but impossible for her to mess with it. The Monday thru Friday only alarm setting means I don't need to change settings for the weekend. The only negative, and it's hard to call it a negative, is the alarm is very loud. There is no way to adjust it. Simply put - you will not sleep through this alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Bikedude2

customer_reviews.title: Cuts down on repeat questions from dementia patient.
customer_reviews.text: This has been working out well. Bought it to cut down on dementia questions of "What day is today." These questions were several times a day and it is a rare question now. We like that days and months are not abbreviated because some people forget what that means. When we set it up we said it is a "retirement clock" because when people retire they lose track of days. He was not insulted when we called it that and really likes it.
customer_reviews.author: ch

customer_reviews.title: This clock gives you all the information you need at a glance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for mom, at 91 she goes to bed early and sometimes she gets up after an hour or so and thinks it is morning. This clock gives her the information she needs to know whether it is morning noon or night. She did get up the other night because she didn't believe the clock and had to check to see if it was correct. It was and she went back to bed. I was worried it would be too bright at night. Mom said it is perfect and really likes the clock. I may get one for the living room. She has only had it for a short while but so far a Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my elderly mother since she sleeps with the lights on and gets her days and times mixed up. One is in the bedroom and one is in the living room. I have since bought one for myself because it is so useful. My 20+ niece wants one for her dorm room! One thing to note....If it isn't bright enough for you, it is adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: A Constant Reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Clock for Dementia and Oldsters in General
customer_reviews.text: Excellent clock for my wife who has dementia and can no longer read a "analog" clock. Great that I can make the readings in German as that is her native language, and becomes more prevalent as the disease progresses. Also good for my 70 year old eyes. Just wish it was battery powered as that would allow for freedom for placement. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Mash

customer_reviews.title: Have bought two now
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my elderly mom who really also needed the date and what part of day it was, meaning the 'morning, afternoon, evening' feature that really helps her at first glance to know what part of the day it is. When you get old and sleep a fair amount its easy not to know if its early or late sometimes so I will always look for that feature. Also the lettering is nice and clear, I can read the whole display from outside her room easily, very nice. But a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: catwoman322

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for someone in assisted living
customer_reviews.text: We recently had to admit an aunt into Assisted Living. She kept asking what time it was, and what day it was. This filled the void. Now when she asks we can point to the clock. The facility has activities on various days, and we are hoping she will see what day it is on the clock and make it to various activities and appointments.
customer_reviews.author: K. T. Shopper

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT ATOMIC!!
customer_reviews.text: They say for seniors but impossible to set, impossible to understand the instructions. My son had to set it for me. Now with daylight savings time, he will have to come over and RE-set it. IT IS NOT ATOMIC. Also, loses 2 minutes about every 2 weeks. After my son is done working on it, I do like the face, but wish it was easy to set, as it SHOULD be, and wish it kept time ATOMICALLY, as advertised. THIS IS A FAKE!!
customer_reviews.author: Donna in Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: My kids make fun of this clock
customer_reviews.text: My kids make fun of this clock, but I absolutely love the two I ordered. I have one in the foyer and one in the master bedroom. It is large so we can see it without our glasses on in the middle of the night. Sometimes when you are half asleep it is great to know what day of the week it is without thinking. I only work a few days a week and work only every other day, so I like this clock. I am thinking about ordering it as a gift for the grandparents. I think it would also be good for younger children just learning to read and know the days of the week.
customer_reviews.author: Camping Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: My 100 Year Old Mother Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: Mom is turning 100 this year and is in assisted living. She used to be confused sometimes after waking up from a nap or an overnight sleep. She wouldn't know if it was day or night or what day it was. We positioned the clock so she can easily see it whenever she wakes. It was a perfect Christmas gift for it and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: IRead IWrite

customer_reviews.title: Customer service was awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but I’m nervous about the quality. The first one died after only three and a half months but the customer service was excellent. They responded to my email in a timely manner and agreed to replace the bad unit. I have to say, I missed not seeing that large & readable display while I was waiting for a replacement. New one arrived today...so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great product for my mom with dementia.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. My mom just recently was admitted to a memory center and one of the many questions she asks constantly is, what day is it. This clock is very easy to see from across the room. There is no glare. I love it. Well worth the price. It gives my mom a little confidence in one area. My husband was so impressed with this clock after seeing it, he ordered one for his dad.
customer_reviews.author: mrs.strutt

customer_reviews.title: This clock is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Dad needed help knowing what day of the week it was, the date and if morning or night and this clock is perfect. It was very easy to setup - just plug in! You may have to adjust the time zone but it automatically finds the time/date. Everyone who sees this clock wants one. It automatically dims at 7 PM so not the (very) bright screen all night. You can still see the info, just dimmed. It must be plugged into power (does not use batteries) so may not fit everywhere if no outlet but we used an extension cord and it is fine. Considering getting him a second one for another room.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy A. Traylor

customer_reviews.title: Solves a problem
customer_reviews.text: I had a friend 70, who lives alone who was diagnosed so I got her one but she doesn’t like alarms or reminders. My mother is good but she liked the large display so she can see it across the room. We put it in our living room and my husband and I like it too. Now my mom’s sister could use one so it’s definitely a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Debra P.

customer_reviews.title: Good features.
customer_reviews.text: Good features. It came with the time and other settings pre-set - only had to adjust the time by a few minutes, but makes me wonder if the battery is replaceable(the instructions don't mention a battery) and if I will have to periodically adjust the time. I don't mind too much since I got this for an Alzheimer's patient who was recently up and fully dressed at 3:30 AM ready to go. Hoping it will help him to do things when appropiate. I was going for price so time will tell if this was a good decision
customer_reviews.author: hlc

customer_reviews.title: Just What Was Needed...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mom as she is getting to the point where she is often not aware of the day and time or even time of day . This clock/calendar really helps. She called me and said it was the best gift she's ever received. I know she doesn't remember all the gifts shes gotten over the years but I'm happy this makes her happy and brings some order to her life. The company is also sensitive to users' needs by not mentioning "Dementia," "Alzheimer's," or other terms indicating memory or forgetfulness.
customer_reviews.author: Spectre

customer_reviews.title: Favorite item in the living room!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my Mom for Xmas last year and she comments all the time it's the #1 thing she depends on and loves to have handy. So I bought another for her visit while at my house and I have to admit, it's handy with the large print, can see it across the room. Can set alarms for medication or reminders also. Will give as a give to any elderly person. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Qantelle

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CLOCK but needs to be larger.....
customer_reviews.text: Great clock but needs to be larger. The information given is perfect for anyone with memory issues, however the screen itself is definitely smaller than I had anticipated. I bought this for my husband and was going to send it back because of the size but he insisted we keep it as it helps him a lot. The amount of times he asks what day it is, whether it is evening or morning, etc. has diminished greatly. Hoping that a larger clock becomes available soon!!! Would buy 2 or 3 of them to have around the house.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great day clock
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 86 year old father and we both really like it. You can see at a glance the time, day, and date, and it keeps us both on track. The set up was easy and it looks really nice. I had bought a different day clock for my mother years ago, it had hands that told both the day and time. But it confused both of us, it was not easy to read. This clock is great and I highly recommend it to anyone who loses track of the days at times.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Wulf

customer_reviews.title: very helpful for my aging mom
customer_reviews.text: this clock was perfect for my mom while in a nursing home. perfect size for her to easily keep up with the time and the day of the week. everyone else wanted one too. I had bought another one in the past, but this one worked upon opening, is durable, and big enough display that my mom could see it across the room, but it did not take up too my space
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bright display. Dont like the morning/afternoon/evening feature.
customer_reviews.text: This clock is similar to others of it's kind except you cannot turn off morning/afternoon/evening display . The other similar product I bought over 1 year ago did allow turning that feature. It makes display too busy. Bummer. Otherwise, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, large font
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad in the hopes it would help him with not getting his mornings and evenings mixed up. He unfortunately passed before getting much use out of it and it now resides with us. I love the large font as it makes it easy to view from across the room. The self dimmer is a nice feature and the whole design is very sleek. This would be a great addition to most homes - even if you're not getting it for a memory aid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT DISPLAY
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this clock. I love the clearly indicated day of the week, time of day, date and clear to read display of the digital read out. This clock displays all that is needed for daily time checks etc. My only disappointment is that the power source is a cord. I truly thought the clock ran on battery power. I must have misread the item description before purchase. I am keeping the clock. I just with I didn't have a cord hanging down the wall. It would be so much nicer if this were a battery run clock instead of a plug in power source.
customer_reviews.author: 3GIRLSMOM

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.text: Always lived with the feeling that having clocks and watches around meant too much effort tracking time instead of enjoying the moment. While I still hold that to be a valiant life goal, unfortunately it just helps to have a nice reminder of what time it is. Plain and simple. Annoying having to check a smart phone all the time and track the time. But this clock is very useful, easy to set up and everything a person needs. Nice big display. Option for the brightness to dim during specified evening hours. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tater

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice
customer_reviews.text: I have an assisted living facility so I bought this for our elderly residents. It’s been received well. However, I think it takes our brain a second or two to read it because there are so much information to take in on a compact space. The date is in tiny print so your eyes have to adjust and scan. It would be nicer to have it change to different screens, time, day, date, etc at a time
customer_reviews.author: S. Vasquez

Whether you're looking for the right day clock for an aging loved one or are teaching schoolchildren how to read the time and date, our uniquely designed digital alarm day clock is the only one you'll ever need. Aging people faced with Alzheimer's, memory loss and dementia need structure, routine and focus. They often lose the ability to recognize what day of the week it is. Traditional digital clocks have abbreviations, which can be confusing. To prevent this, the day clock by SVINZ has a clear and easy to read screen which helps reduce anxiety about the time of day and ease the worry of missing an appointment, mealtime, or any other key event. [19:00hrs] to 7 A.M. [07:00 hrs] - Silent in operation - Fully automatic calendar changes including Leap Years. - Auto Built-in "On-OFF" Memory Settings - Power Adapter - 100-250V AC - Output DC 5Volt 1amp. What you get: SDC008W Alarm Day Clock, AC Adapter, Welcome Guide, Worry-free 12-month Warranty.

Clock also displays MORNING, AFTERNOON, EVENING, NIGHT and PREDAWN during the following times: 5:00 am - 11:59 am (MORNING), 12:00 pm - 4:59 pm (AFTERNOON), 5:00 pm to 8:59 pm (EVENING), 9:00 pm to 11:59 pm (NIGHT) and 12:00 am - 4:59 am(PREDAWN).

✔ UNIQUE FEATURES: This alarm day clock is one of a kind. It includes an alarm function and 2-color display option (White / Yellow). Users can set up to 3 daily alarms which are very useful for senior people for daily meals or for taking medications.

✔ ENLARGED A.M/P.M.: This clock has enlarged A.M. /P.M. font and the height is 3/4’’. Those special loved ones will not confuse morning and night anymore.
